autoval_utils = None¶

smart_data_patterns is the list of regex pattern to look in the smart data to get the stats. The key is the string that will be the smart key in smartdata dictionary and the value is the value collected from smart output Note: Group the exact value you want to pull from smart log Example: gplogPage6Id24Counter : 0x06s+0x018(w+)s+xxx for the above item the smart log is searched for 0x06s+0x018(w+)s+xxx pattern and the value that is captured in the place of w+ and will be saved with key as gplogPage6Id24Counter if a match found else ignore and continue to next item in the dict Note : dont forget to group the value you want to capture in the regex

blockname = None¶

Defines dict datastructure for SMART attributes with the following layout: ATTRIBUTE_ID: { MANUFACTURER: { ‘Desc’: DESCRIPTION, ‘Min’:

MIN_VALUE, ‘Max’: MAX_VALUE}}

With:

Required fields: ATTRIBUTE_ID = SMART Attribute ID (1 - 249) MANUFACTURER: INTEL, TOSHIBA, SAMSUNG or Common DESCRIPTION: Field name of SMART attribute

Optional fields: MIN_VALUE: Minimum value to check during verification. Test will

throw error if actual value is below this value.

MAX_VALUE: Maximum value to check during verification. Test will

throw error if actual value is above this value.

Min and Max values are coming from this task: #6143034
